ğ•¿ğ–ğ–Š ğ•¼ğ–šğ–Šğ–Šğ–“
By Andrew Morton

After seeing all the Platinum Jubilee celebrations at the beginning of the month I really enjoyed reading this biography about our Sovereign.

Of course I was aware of most of the big events that have happened throughout Queen Elizabeth reign from watching the Crown TV series and the news etc over the years but this book offered a closer personal look at The Queen's responses to particular events.

I loved the fact that she was called Lilibet by her father and close family members and I enjoyed hearing about her sense of humour.

Having such an important role in the monarchy and to lead the country for 70 years through changing times over 7 decades I think is absolutely marvelous.

I thought enjoyed learning more about our Queen.

Thank you to @lovebookstours for sending me my copy and having me along for the blog tour.

Book 33 of 2022

ğŸ“–Book Reviewâ ğŸ“–
Book #7 of 2022â 
â 
Facial Justice by L. P. Hartleyâ 
Published by @penguinukbooks / @penguinclassicsâ 
â 
ğŸ’­My review:â 
Picked this one up for my January book club read.â 
â 
Never heard of this book or the author before, but really liked the sound of the synopsis.â 
â 
This is about a way of living after world war three and is run by a dictator, who thinks everyone should be treated equally. So everyone must have the same as everyone else, to not causeâ 
jealousy. And this also means looking the same too. so women have operations on their faces to make them look the same or beta.â 
â 
I liked how this book explored how people can be envious of what others have and what needs to be done to make everyone feel equal.â 
â 
There were parts of this book that I found a bit confusing but overall I really enjoyed it.â 
4.5 stars for me â 
â­â­â­â­ğŸ’«

Sometimes life is even scarier than fiction,  like when hackers launch a cyber war and unleash an age of global chaos. My latest book mail from @hachettebooks addresses the incredible untold origin story of cyberwar and the hackers who unleashed it on the world, tracing their journey from the ashes of the Cold War to the criminal underworld, governments, and even Silicon Valley. 
â˜ ï¸
Two years before 9/11, the US was attacked by an unknown enemy. No warning was given, and it didn't target civilians. Instead, tomahawk missiles started missing their targets, US agents were swept up by hostile governments, and Americaâ€™s enemies seemed to know its every move in advance. A new phase of warfareâ€”cyber warâ€”had arrived. And within two decades it escaped Pandora's Box, plunging us into a state of total war where every day, countless cyber attacks perpetrated by states and mercenaries are reshaping the world.
â˜ ï¸
After receiving an anonymous email with leaked NATO battle plans during the bombardment of Kosovo, journalist Matt Potter embarked on a 20-year investigation into the origins of cyber war and how it came to dominate the world. He uncovered its beginnings in the last days of the Cold War, as the US and its allies empowered a generation of Eastern European hackers, only to wake up in the late 90's to a new world order. It'sÂ a story that winds through Balkan hacking culture, Russia, Silicon Valley, and the Pentagon. Never before told, this is the riveting secret history of cyberwar.
â˜ ï¸
We Are All Targets hits the stands on January 10, 2023. It sounds like a heavy read,  but I'm definitely interested in learning more about this topic. 
â˜ ï¸

We have so kindly been gifted some flash cards and a beautiful book from @the_little_bw_book_project ! 

The Little Black and White Book
Project products are designed to add no-pressure sensory play to your day using black and white animal themed flash cards and books to support your little oneâ€™s visual and brain development from day one to pre-school and beyond.

Cooper loves looking at all the animals and listening to me talking about them using the flash cards!
These have been great at keeping him engaged and calm after long days of excitement!

My first ever chapter book ğŸª„ Tales of the Witches Cat by @kirstie_watson_author is on sale and itâ€™s great! So happy to get my copy and look through it all. 

I learnt a lot from this one on how chapter books work. Unlike picture books often the simple illustrations work best. Also unlike picture books details donâ€™t show up as much. See the picture of the bookshelf? Every book has a title and I spent ages coming up with magic related puns and funny book titles and you canâ€™t see a single one ğŸ˜‚ still it was so much fun and I look forward to doing more.

*Tummy Time*

Tummy time versi Baby Nadhif ini selalu dikasih softbook biar dia lebih betah tengkurap dan melatih kekuatan lehernya 

Nadhif udah ditengkurapin dari umur 3 minggu. Durasinya juga gak lama, 
Mungkin paling lama 5 menit, atau kalo dia udah mulai gak nyaman kayak nangis langsung dibalik lagi badannya. Senyamannya dia ajasih, mama Nadhif juga gak memaksakan.

Alhamdulillah umur 2,5 bulan udah bisa tengkurap sendiri tapi kadang masih perlu bantuan dan pas 3 bulan bisa tengkurap sendiri tanpa bantuan. Tummy time juga lebih lama durasinya dan Nadhif lebih aktif untuk menggapai barang yg ada didepannya saat tengkurap.

Kenapa kok milih softbook kok bukan mainan aja ? 
ğŸ”¸Mau kenalin buku dari bayi. 
ğŸ”¸Newborn itu pertama hanya bisa melihat warna hitam putih, jadi cari buku yg warna hitam putih
ğŸ”¸Bahanya lembut dan bisa dicuci juga kalo udah mulai kotor. 
ğŸ”¸ Aman buat dimainin bayi

Dan buku first colour dari @foxandbunny.id yg jadi pilihan mama Nadhif. 

Tips dr Mama Nadhif ajak tummy time 
jangan kondisi kenyang/ habis minum susu yaa, ntar gumoh(muntah) dan juga jangan kondisi mengantuk nnt rewel dan gak bisa happy anaknya. 

Semangat belajar parenting buat kita semua mama baru ğŸ˜ƒğŸ˜ƒ

New author.
New book.
New experience.
Today at The Eden Mills Writersâ€™ Festival
I met @stephenmdorsey who talked about the experience of writing this memoir, but also about how to bridge the divides of understanding. He says that after the â€œglobal reckoning of the last two yearsâ€, this is still an urgent subject: the multicultural perspective of white advantage & the paths of change.
I found his presentation and the excerpt from his first book entitled â€œBlack & Whiteâ€ so moving and enlightening that I got his book right after the event â€œThe Balancing Act of Nonfictionâ€ at the Eden Mills Writers Festival and got it signed up.
It was an epic day of writing and reading amidst the wonderful natural setting of Eden Mills. A great â€œopen air, open book, open mindâ€ annual event that took place on September 6th at Eden Mills, Ontario.

Black and white baby board books

This was one of the first books I got Maisie when I started working with Usborne and she still loves it now at 2.5 years old!

We used them when she was doing tummy time so she had something to look at while building her neck muscles and then as she got older it gave her something to try and crawl towards and reach for â˜ºï¸

The robust board books in this set will fascinate babies and introduce them to the world around them! From animals and the wonders of the outside world, to joys of saying hello and bedtime routines this collection is perfect for developing young minds. 

Every page in each book is designed to stimulate babies, with striking high-contrast illustrations and inviting holes to peep-through.

Animals, Bedtime, Outdoors and Hello!
